head.supplied: 17th April 1885 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I beg to send you Newspaper report of my Inaugural Lecture at Ormond College & at the same time to thank your Excellency for bringing my name under the notice of the Hon. M...

div.p: GO 39/8 miscellaneous correspondence addressed to the Governor 1861-85, Governor's Office, Archives Office of Tasmania, State Library of Tasmania, Hobart.

I beg to send you Newspaper report of my Inaugural Lecture at Ormond College & at the same time to thank your Excellency for bringing my name under the notice of the Hon. Mr Service. He very kindly gave me a recommendatory letter in connection with my application for a University Appointment & I need hardly say it was of great value to me.

I have been asked to commence a course of Evening Lectures in Melbourne & intend doing so. Through my friend Baron Mueller I have had introductions to the Bishop of Melbourne & others who will be pleased to extend their patronage to my lectures. It would also be extremely useful to have a note of introduction to his excellency the Governor here & I thought such might come most appropriately from you.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
